intro: Matelea longifolia, commonly known as the long-flowered matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a yellow throat. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Matelea longifolia is often found in desertscrub habitats and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
